project.teaser: REFINE develops and demonstrates a system of artificial photosynthesis by combining both dark and light-dependent reactions for the direct production of high energy density and essential chemicals, such as alcohols. To achieve this, a direct hydrogen storage into hydrocarbons...
project.objective: REFINE develops and demonstrates a system of artificial photosynthesis by combining both dark and light-dependent reactions for the direct production of high energy density and essential chemicals, such as alcohols. To achieve this, a direct hydrogen storage into hydrocarbons through CO2 capture and transformation in an advanced bio-refining system is proposed. In this, hydrogen produced by water photoelectrolysis is combined with captured CO2 and directly fed to biocultures that selectively produce isopropanol and butanol as high energy solar fuels, and the only energy input to drive this radical technological system is sunlight. To realise and bring to the market such a system of artificial photosynthesis it is necessary to converge the fields of materials science, biotechnology, engineering and social sciences. The project organisation is multicentred and operates at different levels; from raw materials supply considerations, societal acceptance, materials engineering and nanostructuring to device assembling and applicability. The true converging nature of REFINE provides a holistic, ground-breaking approach that addresses major challenges of our modern societies such as the extensive CO2 emissions and inability for efficient and widely accepted CO2 recycling. The vision in REFINE extends well beyond the 4-year activities proposed in this application. Still, REFINE is the seed for a multidimensional approach to critical scientific and societal challenges.
project.title: From solar energy to fuel: A holistic artificial photosynthesis platform for the production of viable solar fuels
project.keywords: artificial photosynthesis, carbon capture and utilization, butanol, energy, fuels, solar fuels

article.title: A radical artificial photosynthesis system for solar fuel production

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - REFINE (From solar energy to fuel: A holistic artificial photosynthesis platform for the production of viable solar fuels)
result.teaser: Emissions and lack of recycling of anthropogenic CO2 cause detrimental climate changes, with consequential natural and societal disasters. Taking example from nature and how natural systems such as photosynthesis recycle CO2 back to high energy value compounds can pave the way...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: D6.1 Low damage solar cell cutting
result.description: IFE performs Si solar cells processing for the construction of PV modules to drive Unit 1. Laser cutting of Si solar cells induces damages, which are minimised in REFINE by new processes developed at IFE.

result.title: D19.2 Communication materials
result.description: This is communication materials such as promo video and the project website.

result.title: D14.1 Materials properties suitable for Unit 1 (draft)
result.description: A first draft report on materials properties suitable for Unit 1 is delivered. This is based on tecnoeconomic and sociaetal aspects.

result.title: D2.1 Functionalised platform materials by exsolution
result.description: In this deliverable developments regarding the OER catalysts needed for Unit 1 are reported. UiO is co-beneficiary as well.

result.title: D19.3 Workshop on novel electrode materials
result.description: This is a planned workshop at the facilities of partner 4 (AUTh - Greece) on novel electrode materials.

result.title: D2.2 Functionalised platform materials by galvanic replacement
result.description: As in D2.1, developments regarding the OER catalysts for Unit 1 are reported. UiO is also co-benecifiary.

result.title: D16.1 Social science measurement framework (draft)
result.description: An empirical measurement framework, that meets the quality standards of social science measurements in terms of objectivity, reliability, and validity of instruments is delivered. This the first, draft version.

result.title: D14.1 Materials properties suitable for Unit 1 (final)
result.description: The final report on materials properties suitable for Unit 1 is delivered. This is based on tecnoeconomic and sociaetal aspects.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
